intro: Puelia occidentalis, commonly known as western puelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Puelia occidentalis is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a weed in some regions.
